{{ja-kanjitab|神|楽|鈴}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かぐらすず|神楽|tr1=kagura|t1=divine entertainment|鈴|tr2=suzu|t2=bells}}.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かぐら すず}}

# a [[three]]-[[tier]]ed [[set]] of [[bell]]s [[suspend]]ed by [[coil]]ed [[brass]] [[wire]]s on a [[hand-held]] [[rod]] used in the [[kagura]] [[dance]]s by [[巫女#Japanese|Miko]].
#: The [[inspiration]] for the [[shape]] of the bells is thought to have been the [[fruit]]s of the [[ogatama]] [[tree]] ({{ja-l|小賀玉の木}}, {{ja-l|黄心樹}}, {{ja-l|招霊の木}}, {{ja-l|オガタマノキ}} (''ogatama no ki''): {{taxlink|Magnolia compressa|species|noshow=1}}).
